div.p: I write you in great haste as I have an opportunity of sending it by our friend J H McAfee—My guns have come to hand tents to my great disapointment—the tents have not gotten here. I was so anxious to go into camp in order to get my men well drilled that I now have them camping on the bare ground in the open air almost without covering—I felt so assured that the tents would reach Coffeeville in a day or two that I thought I would risk it in the open air for a day or two—I do hope if the tents have not been sent forward that they will be sent by the first train. Our friend McAfee will give his personal attention to shipping them.

Your Obt St
A. K. Blythe
